definitions: the small oval dark or pale brown seed of a flowering plant of the mint family, used in various foods to add fiber and micronutrients.

notes.text: The seeds are obtained from Salvia hispanica (family Lamiaceae), originating in Central America and widely cultivated, and Salvia columbariae (golden chia), native to Mexico and the southern US

shortDefinitions: seed of plant of mint family

definitions: either of the plants from which chia seeds are obtained.
shortDefinitions: plant from which chia is obtained
